website_summaries.verdict: The wire-free Jabra Elite Active 65t earphones are built for exercise, with secure-fitting earpieces that deliver powerful bass that can be adjusted to your liking.
cons: Auto-pair process can be cumbersome, with only one earpiece pairing at times
Not for purists seeking accurate audio

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed from the first day, Nice packaging OK, but this not what you are going to wear on your ears. -With or without noise cancelation every time you are walking you hear your steps, bum bum bum... -They hurt my ears, not the ear tip but the actual plastic going to your ear shell, its too big maybe for me. All the time you are with them your mind is there , no chance of relax and comfort. -Three days after the purchase, left earbud stop working. For that price tag I really expected much more. I recon go for some other brand or wait for the new model to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Beson

customer_reviews.title: Cuts out and doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the previous version of these for months, they have come to the end of their life (power button has broken). I decided to upgrade to the latest in the Jabra range with these - wished I hadn't. They look great and have some clever features but the sound cuts out constantly from the phone just being in my pocket. Also they just don't fit! I've tried all of the ear buds in the box and expensive 3rd party ones. It's not just me, I asked my wife to try them; same problem. I wouldn't recommend these, stick to the older pulse versions. I'm returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Alex P

customer_reviews.title: Great ear buds, bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: Amended, Jabra replaced a faulty bud without too much fuss once I showed them a screenshot of my Amazon purchase, I have loved using these for nearly 2 years now, top notch ear buds, much better than anything else I've owned, great for running, perfect fit without annoying wings
customer_reviews.author: Damien Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: If you have small ears don't buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is perfect except 1 thing... Too big for my ear. My ears are small and it doesn't fit. I love these earphones, are amazing. The sound quality it's fantastic, battery like too. I bought it from a stire in Ireland. I paid 200 € and I will probably have to give them back. Other issue: the magnets in the case are not very strong, so please pay attention when putting them back to charge in order to avoid falls. Walking on stteet with traffic etc. perfect. Rarely the sound cuts off.
customer_reviews.author: Namah Karah

customer_reviews.title: Terribly uncomfortable and poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic exterior is so painfully uncomfortable. This may be down to my ear shape, Pressing the buttons on the sides of the headphones requires force which pushes them further into your ears, Resulting further pain and discomfort from the shape and increasing suction from the in ear making it extremely uncomfortable and rendering the sound inaudible. The equaliser provided in the app makes it sound super tinny regardless of your EQ, I have a pair of Jlab jbuds for bluetooth wired headphones that perform better than these, They are far more comfortable and the sound quality is FAR superior. I am very very disappointed with these given the £140 price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Lindsley

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - flawed design
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a lot of true wireless headphones and at first these were quite impressive. The sound quality is good and they’re probably the best you can get for making calls, no doubt due to Jabra’s pedigree for handsfree calling. After about two weeks however, I started having serious connectivity issues followed shortly by an inability to charge the pods, rendering them pretty much useless. In summary: good when they work but they broke. I’ve had much more success with Sol Amps Air which were cheaper and have much deeper bass albeit that they are useless for handsfree calling
customer_reviews.author: Aliray

customer_reviews.title: Elite?
customer_reviews.text: I've had to rewrite my 5* review. When working these earbuds are excellent. All the features work great. However, I'm on my third set in 6 weeks! They look well put together on the outside but jabra must penny pinch on the inside. The first two sets the left earbud started to fizzle out gradually to nothing. And on the third the sound is beset with intermittent crackling. These are anything but for the 'ACTIVE' lifestyle. I was nervous about spending so so much money, now just regretful.
customer_reviews.author: Tzar

customer_reviews.title: ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price you expect it to be something special however ive taken them out and tested them and can advise the noise cancelling is next to non existent. The bass is terrible the music sounds flat and the apps bass boost does nothing. They do fit in the ear well for what its worth and the charging case is nice however at £150 i expect the bass and noise cancelling to work properly. i have to raise the question are all these 5 star reviews fake? cant comment on gym use as after a test wearing out im not impressed and returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Draxor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed; bad static problems, uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: When the headphones are turned up to any reasonable volume there is very annoying static in left ear, and pretty noticeable static in right ear. I needed to wear the largest tips to ensure there was a good fit and seal which wasn't particularly comfortable and gave me with a headache after only wearing them for a few minutes. I ended up returning them, which was very disappointing as I had read so many good reviews for these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good for calls. Poor bass
customer_reviews.text: I mainly needed something for calls. I went through 2 other makes (£50 and £25) ones but microphone quality wasn’t good enough. Finally bit bullet and went for Jabras. Pros - Connectivity - Sound quality on calls Cons - Bass is not good. Even using equaliser on app - case is hard to open and you risk the ear buds flying out when it does open Right earbud failed after a week but amazon excellent at exchanging next day.
customer_reviews.author: Jdr99

customer_reviews.title: Excellent totally wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: These have so far proven comfortable. The audio quality is very good and I like the cute and small case. I also like the app. This is the second Jabra product I've bought and I'm impressed. Haven't yet run out of battery as the longest I've used the headphones is about three hours in one session, but they do seem to recharge very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Russell Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pair of wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Having tried a few pairs of wireless earbuds and never finding the right pair, I'm glad to say these are finally the earbuds I was looking for Sound quality is excellent, and I've had no connectivity issues barring a handful of hiccups where the left earbuds cut out for a seconds, otherwise is unnoticeable on my Bluetooth 4 phone (OnePlus 3) Battery life is great, with daily office use I've found that popping them back into the case occasionally for a few minutes is enough to keep them charged throughout the day. They also fit incredibly well. I've taken them out rock climbing with me and never felt like they were even close to slipping out. Great earbuds
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like heaven
customer_reviews.text: Love the style and design. Very secure and comfortable feel in the ear. Unbelievably easy to pair to each earbud and also the source ( If in doubt use the app.) Sound quality is the best that I have so far tried. Maybe not the most dynamic if bass is your prime need, but music and in particulary classical is well balanced across the sound spectrum, separation is superb and gives a true representation of a live orchestra. Love them and can recommend. Only minor negative, is the quality and functionality of the charge box and its led light indication.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Satterley

customer_reviews.title: Everything is good exept the case, connection/audio issue
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these are lovely, so comfortable, good sound quality, the app is easy to navigate. I have one issue the case for the puds is not great its can be very stiff to open. Updated 15.01.20 Im find when you connect the device it does always play your audio straight away. It plays for 1sec cuts out then plays for 1sec, this will keep happening until you disconnect your device then reconnect. The only solutions to this is once you are connected do not use any audio for 5mins and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: steven-b

customer_reviews.title: jabra ear buds
customer_reviews.text: good product though not without little flaws , but as long as you can handle occasional technical glitches then these are good. I link in with my laptop via bluetooth for conference calls and the mic works well. at the same time im linked to my phone, so you can connect to two devices at the same time, if you get a call it will allow you to answer that and the music you are listening to stops. takes a bit of time getting used to which earbud to press for different functions but I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Odlid

customer_reviews.title: It's almost perfect, I hate the cradle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great headphone. The Sound quality is great. The battery life is impressive (never managed to deplete it). Noise cancellation is ok but could be better. The only thing that's a let down is the cradle design. It takes me 3 tries to open the led, there is no clear ledge to go against your finger to open the holder and it can be very fiddly. I do not like the fact that even though this technology is advanced, it still uses micro usb, it should be C type to make it compatible with whatever you're using this with.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Wireless issues with Galaxy Note 8
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a cheap wireless set to these true wireless set which seemed to have rave reviews all over the www. When I first used them holding phone in my hand they were fire but when I put phone into jacket/coat they kept cutting out. Contacted Jabra who sent what was obviously a stock reply, worked my way through their various suggestions but to no avail. Returned them and purchased Masters and Dynamic MW07 which arrived today and are absolutely brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Henson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t fit unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: The packaging and feel of these earbuds is really impressive however the buds just don’t fit my ears so I’m not really able to review the sound quality. I have problems with a lot of in ear headphones as I have very small ears so this shouldn’t be taken as a big negative for these ear buds. My partner doesn’t have any problems getting headphones to fit. He used them for a run and said they were great for about 3 miles but then they got sweaty and started slipping out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Day

customer_reviews.title: For once, some GOOD advice from my mate!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the gym, snug fit and surprisingly good sound quality. Pretty sure that these are not actively noise cancelling, they just block out outside noise by being a snug fit in your ear. Free app can be downloaded which allows you to tweak the EQ levels and control the level of outside noise which is mixed in with the bluetooth audio (good if you’re running outside). Easy pairing and intuitive control on the earbuds themselves which is nice. Haven’t used them for a call yet. Charging case is neat and clever and quite compact. Battery life and charge cycles seem to be as advertised. All in all very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Great but terrified of losing one
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and the sound quality is excellent, they hook up easily to YouTube and block out the background noise of the office and help me concentrate at work. Not quite as noise-cancelling as I’d been led to believe, but will cancel out average office noise. They fit beautifully in my ears too using the medium ear bud. I like the handy little case they come in, which both protects and charges them. Only thing is, I’m terrified of losing one, so still using my wired Apple earphones when walking to work. Think it would be good to have the option to connect them to each other on a removable cord
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these.... excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds, very nicely made and very comfortable. Using the application from the Google Play Store these were very easy to setup and configure to my personal preferences. Sound quality is excellent and the built-in equaliser within the application is excellent for configuring the sound to you personal preferences. Call quality is excellent and it is easy to setup with Alexa or the Google Assistant. The earbuds are nicely made and they a premium look and feel and I have used many Bluetooth wireless earbuds and these are probably the best so far, unlike some others I have not noticed any disconnections or drop outs or lag when watching videos. I can highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Nikob

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Like: the sound is incredible and I have tried many different wireless headphones previously. They connected to my phone really quickly and unlike some other headphones they dont try and connect with other headsets when I'm in busy places like the gym ! Dislike: when I want to share the sound with someone else they cant listen using one headphone they sound will just stop when they have been separated which is a bit annoying
customer_reviews.author: Pippa

customer_reviews.title: Hit and miss need improvement poor range despite Bluetooth v5
customer_reviews.text: Hit and miss with these have mixed reviews on general performance. Left ear bud sometimes cuts out for no reason, very poor range despite the fact they are Bluetooth v5. Nice sound when they finally want to connect sometimes must restart device for them to connect. Jabra support is rubbish and slow over one week for email which didn't resolve the issue I have with these. Would have liked to have a UK phone support, would not buy again to many niggly issue that need resolving. Possibly in the future they may cum up with a firmware update to resolve the common problems with these headphones
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. McReynolds

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in quick time and looks very attractive as a product. Pros: connects quickly, good sound, looks really good and fits really snug in your ears. Cons: battery life wasn’t as good as advertised, frequent drop outs of sound while listening to music, especially the left ear bud, when using over phone calls, they only hear the background sound and not me when I was speaking, that was a major flaw as I wanted something discreet and works really well. The buds are very discreet but the performance as far as voice could be a lot better. Will continue to give this a try and see if I can be turned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Martindale

customer_reviews.title: NOT FIT FOR PURPOSE
customer_reviews.text: I found these very frustrating. It's an ongoing struggle to try and find the right position in the ear. They're not very loud. I push them in to try get more volume and I can barely hear them. I turn to one side and one of them cuts out. And while I'm running I get a constant "Whoomp whoomp whoomp" on every pace. I've tried these over a few runs and different conditions and come to the conclusion they are not nearly worth the money. I want a refund but according to Amazon I can't any more. I'm not spending £100+ on something that doesn't work. Will try contacting Jabra directly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, small form, big comfort
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with these wireless earbuds. They're small enough, I don't have to worry about sweat or some rain and they work great. The sound is where they really shine, the bass presence is really great. There is an app that shows you how to use them, and lets you customize an equaliser to your tastes. If you're looking for an alternative to other, white, wireless earbuds these are definitely worth consideration. While they don't have noise "cancellation" the isolation provided by the different sized buds is great. And the ability to quickly engage the microphone so you can hear your surroundings is very clever.
customer_reviews.author: J Shulman

customer_reviews.title: Take a while to get used to, in the end its worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to write this review. Bought it during the Black Friday of Nov 2019. Got a great price for this on Amazon. Product Fit: in the beginning, it took a while to get used to it. The buds would drop out, will not fit it etc. But eventually got the hang of it. The ear grove aches though after a few hours of usage, could be a personal thing. Robust: despite the buds falling more than a dozen instances, it was strong and did not break. From that perspective, absolute value for money. Sound: great sound, its JBL. If you are getting a deal in sub 120 GBP, it's a fantastic deal. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sujeeth Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Was Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking,Nice fit in ear but overhaul not impressed with performance and sound very slow responce and just didn't like the sound I have a cheaper set and have to admit never and less than half price of these as for nice cancel still hear traffic.So sorry returned for refund and await Sony's new sport set out in July.
customer_reviews.author: DJW

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd like them but I don't
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is ok and I was fairly pleased with the noise cancellation capability, however, the ergonomic aspect is utterly awful. My inside ears are in pain only after 30 min of wearing. Regardless of using the smallest ear tip, the pain is so much the I have to remove constantly. The medium fit doesn't enter enough and the small is just right and snug but can easily slide out because of the material, which doesn't grip to the ears walls. In fact, when running they pop out quite easily with the risk of breaking them. I had to give up using them, to be honest. I wish I figured out this early enough to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Connection
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds work fantastic indoors, but when I use outdoors, ie, when out walking, the earbuds Bluetooth connection kept on dropping out. I bought the earbuds mostly for using outdoors, so i returned them. I tried them on Android and Apple devices and Bluetooth dropped out on both. If you are buying for mainly indoor use, i would recommend, but if mainly for outdoor use, I would not recommend the earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID WEBSTER

customer_reviews.title: Best headsets I've owned. Period.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headsets I've ever owned. Light and discreet. You even forget they're in your ear. The sound is excellent, not noise cancelling but pretty good isolation. Great battery life. Great fit even with my small ears. The call quality is inexplicably good! I don't know what Voodoo makes the mics work so well when they are so far back in your ear. I just wish they made active noise cancelling versions. *** Left unit failed, and I’m still dealing with Jabra support. Unfortunately, their support is just terrible. Awaiting the RMA process and really missing some great headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E. Kagbala

customer_reviews.title: Half the product
customer_reviews.text: Regret buying this. Before the purchase I looked online for reviews. The majority were warning about the breaking of the left earbud. Eager to still get them I was just going to hope I wouldn’t get a broken one. Still did. Left earbud. Like many warned me about... it broke after the first week. Started disconnecting or not connecting at all from the start. Would not recommend taking the risk for this amount of money. With that said; sound and noise cancelling are probably still best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Rick de Boer

customer_reviews.title: Two sets. Both broke after a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: Two sets now have broken with the same problem. Right earbud will only produce 10% volume. Jabra customer care are useless and took a month before giving up. Amazon thankfully provide good support. Shame as these were great, for the two months they work
customer_reviews.author: B-Bal

customer_reviews.title: Sound not great even at high volume
customer_reviews.text: They looked good and I liked the appearance and that they fit in your ear. You can also take a call or reject it by pressing the right ear bud. What I found that the sound even with the volume at the highest setting was not very good. Also the ear buds did not cancel out traffic noise or people talking nearby. Although they are designed to fit in the ear they were not a good fit in my ears the ear buds stuck out a lot. I expected better from a well known make from the music industry, so I was really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gordon Turner

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection. Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I've noted these as a one star review, though the noise cancelling is very good along with the sound quality, they cut out so often it almost sounded as though the music was skipping. I spoke with jabra who talked me through an update and I was quite happy this might fix the problem. It didn't. It did nothing. Reading about the Bluetooth 5 or whatever makes it sound like it should be bombproof. I have a pair of £20 tao tronic wireless headphones that are equally as good if not better. Disappointed. Returning to amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: OJordan2011

customer_reviews.title: The sound was too high frequency response but I got it sorted out xx
customer_reviews.text: There are no bass on them it's all high frequency response and a bit of middle frequency response but no low frequency response so I had to used EQ to put it down to bass boost so I can have low frequency response so I can enjoy it better witch it worked very well the battery is fantastic and the app is terrible it connects then disconnects afterwards but the Bluetooth headset still connected even the app says is disconnected it's annoying so I decided not to used the app I have a built in EQ on my phone so I can change the sound and now it's sounds better yay xx
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: JABRA THE HUT.
customer_reviews.text: I paid £47.89 for these on Amazon Warehouse as they had some cosmetic issues. Well I can't find them and they came in their original packaging. These are a well respected make and I have a Jabra hands fee in the car that's been there for ages, the battery lasts forever and its great sound quality. Just like these Earphones. I did order them and then cancel as I thought it was too good a price to be true, however they have more than lived up expectations I'm glad I re-orderd them. Top Banana.
customer_reviews.author: Aliswine

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for women's ears - way too large
customer_reviews.text: I'm slightly taller than the average woman at 5'9" but these earbuds are far too large for the my ears and very uncomfortable. My husband took a photo of my ear to show me and you could see the cartilage was distorted and white (ie lacking blood flow). They're definitely not suitable for a day of calls or long workout, so I returned them. This is probably my fifth or so pair of earbuds & the first I've ever experienced this problem with. Apart from that, they were easy to pair and software seemed easy to use. Sound was ok but nowhere near as good as Airpods Pro or Bose QC, both of which I also own.
customer_reviews.author: rubyblue

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for near enough a year now. I really like these headphones, they are comfortable to wear, have great battery life and work pretty much seamlessly with my phone and laptop - a great feature here is that they can actually be connected to both at the same time, and seamlessly switch between the two when I pause audio on one and play on the other. I have used these for a wide range of activities, from running to simply sitting in the library working and they work great for both. I agree they are quite expensive, but for me worth the money. I would recommend these headphones to anyone looking for a soild pair of wireless earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: Jabra elite ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go with Jabra elite after speaking to a friend of mine. They have not disappointed me yet. They fit snuggly and do not fall out of the eat like other ear buds. Sound quality is good but not excellent, the ear buds are charged in a black pocket case and are great for keeping in my pocket. A charge of the case charges the buds 4 or 5 times, with 5-6 hours or so solid playing time. I’m impressed as they are well made and look the part. Very good item and recommend them to my mates!
customer_reviews.author: cookster623

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a couple of weeks now, so they've been tested on several runs. Sound quality is very good, but at first seemed disappointing, then I switched to the larger earbuds and there was a massive improvement. Fit and comfort is great, I've ran for up to 2 hours and not noticed any discomfort. One fell out once, but that was due to me not securing it properly, do these really do stay in. Battery life is as advertised, after a 2 hour run I have approximately 60% left. I was dubious about true wireless but these are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Connection, Good Enough Sound with EQ App
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of 'usable' true wireless. Never let me down in terms of battery thanks to the charging case. Sound is ok, bass is strong enough without messing the rest of the spectrum. Clarity nowhere near Grado, Sennheiser, AKG or Shure, but being true wireless, sound quality is acceptable, also thanks to EQ within the Jabra App. Reliable and stable bluetooth connection. Good shape and grip, they stay in, but might feel a little big and heavy for some. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Claudio AM

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Using with a Google pixel phone. I found the general sound quality to lacking substantially. In particular the volume and the bass. The app is great in theory, however I found changing the settings made little difference to the sound in general. I also had sound flickering issues when simple walking down the street. I also found them to be very uncomfortable even with the different size ear buds available. After being recommended these by various sites and videos, I am very disappointed in the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Ringer

customer_reviews.title: It's a great choise!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using them every day, and I'm completely in love. They have a great sound, and the possibility of being able to activate/deactivate the noise canceling is great (don't need to take them off. During a call, the person on the other side have a bit of difficulty to listen, because the noise canceling of the micro isn't great, and if you are walking they will year a bit more the street then us. During a normal use, you can hear a bit the cars but i don't mind, I feel a bit safer this way.
customer_reviews.author: Patrícia Clérigo

customer_reviews.title: Too many small let downs for the price
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try these out, unfortunately there was a consistent small popping sound whenever I changed applications on my phone. M ik mor but became irritating over time. Only one headphone being able to work on it's own also became annoying after a while and the case is horrible. Even after a week of constant use it was still annoying putting the buds away in the case as it had no magnetism. Returned fairly easily and the jabra application was brilliant, I especially liked the noise background choices (rain, cafe etc) mic was clear for people to hear during calls.
customer_reviews.author: mariam

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolute rubbish. I read great reviews for these that compared them favourably to a similar Bang and Olufson. However they just did not live up to the hype and are not fit for purpose. Useless for running - the bluetooth just drops out everytime you move your arm, and I could not get Alexa to work - they kept reverting to Siri. All in all - complete waste of money. I bought some alternatives for less than £20 and they performed 10x better.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Louise Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding headphones with limited noise cancelation, but case feels flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Brought these to replace the last version of the Jabra Sport which I had used for a couple of years and really liked, and I have been pleased with these replacements. Pros: good sound, "listen through" feature works well for hearing surrounding environment; good fit in the ear even without "wings" to hold the phones in place like the old Jabra Sport had. Cons: Not so easy to tell left and right phones out of the case; carry case lid feels fragile and flimsy - also difficult to open; noise cancellation is average - you can still hear people talking around you, albeit quieter and less distracting than without the phones in.
customer_reviews.author: GreedyGekko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have been quite happy with these earbuds, using them for videoconferencing at work and listening to music on various devices. They are compact, well made and the app is really helpful. I had some intermittent issues with the sound on the left earbud after about a year of use. I got in touch with the customer service team and they were extremely responsive and helpful, paid for me to ship the old ones back and sent a new pair very quickly. Well done guys, some of the best customer service ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for Sport - Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: They work fine if you just want some compact wireless headphones for your commute. Very prone to interference (in cities anyway) and a tinny sound, but most was as expected with Bluetooth tech. where it is at the moment. The real disappointment is the moisture wicking, which is ineffectual. I'm a distance runner, my first pair lasted about 6 months with plenty of sweat on them before one headphone lost 90% of volume and eventually died, replacement was sent (as I figured I must just be unlucky), new pair lasted 3 days. Amazon tech support said 2/10 customers are having the same issue and they would be launching an investigation. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Rimmy Jumble

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and good price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use, the buttons are a little bit clunky to use (select Next and previous track is quite difficult to push) but other than that a solid pair of earphones! They last the whole working day without charging and charge up fast in the case. Stay in your ear just fine. Only issue I have had was with the left earphone when I think there were signal disturbances from other devices on a train. This is the only time it has worked intermittently.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Pros/Cons
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality just a bit temperamental with connectivity when regularly alternating which device you use it with. Also can be uncomfortable as the different size ear buds are in between the size of my ear so I either have to pick the smaller ones and risk them coming out whilst working out or the next size up can either cause discomfort and/or muffle the sound projection into my ear cannal. Pretty good battery life though and the carry case/power bank charger is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Scully

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. These are my first ear buds, bought after reading customer reviews and comparing similar products. I'm very pleased chose these - comfy to wear, good sound and excellent noise cancellation. Extremely pleased they the quality they are - ear buds, safely in their charging box.. unfortunately fell out of my pocket into a cup of boiling water ( cup was on the floor, i was getting onto sofa..... ) i feared it would cause irrepairable damage, instantly dried them, put all parts in a bowl of rice in a warm place - and they are fully recovered. Am I pleased 😊
customer_reviews.author: Lynda B

customer_reviews.title: Good for music but bad for calls
customer_reviews.text: Positives - Good sound quality with equalizer features through the app - Noise cancellation is effective - Lightweight and decent fit. Comfortable to wear for long time Cons - Quality of voice calls is very bad. You can hear the other person fine but they hear a lot of external noise. Makes it impossible to call someone in a crowded place or on a busy street. Quite a downer for an otherwise fine ear phone - Connectivity is a bit patchy. Has stabilised with recognised devices over time. - Cheap plastic material used makes them very slippery to handle. Easy to drop while retrieving from case. Nightmare if you are in a busy place like a train platform
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think much of this brand at first however, after I tried this product, I'm completely won-over. Its a great product, slightly expensive as it is low on brand-recognition, however you can clearly see/hear, you are paying for the research and development that went in it. Absolutely brilliant product, amazing sound quality (and normally I swear by Bose only) great noise-cancellation, fit and even App. This one won't disappoint, even whilst running with them!
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones, Amazing brand
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! At times they do tend to fall off as my ear conduit is quite small but once you get the trick of turning them and locking them properly these are very good. I struggled at first to pair then with my Sony MP3 player but now it connects automatically to all pre programmed devices. Great quality, haven’t worked out whether the sound is actually that amazing or if I may need some guidance with how to get the beta out of the sound power.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie J.

customer_reviews.title: Really good, give them try
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews before purchasing and thanks to those people posted them. Ive had these for a while now and love them. Once in your ears you forget there in. Sound quality is decent enough with a nice bass responce. Battery life is good and ive never had them go flat on me. Used for travelling to work mainly and always block out the rest of the world. Connection to my s10+ has always been instant and had no issues there either. Made the occasional call and had no complaints from the caller or drop outs. Thanks jabra 👍
customer_reviews.author: Mr H

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on a recommendation to replace an old wired pair I was using for my daily commute. These headphones sound excellent. Although not noise cancelling, they do isolate external sounds well thanks to the wide range of soft silicone buds provided. This is more than adequate to cut out the background noise without having the volume too high. I can't comment on moisture-wicking but they do appear to be pretty sweatproof whilst down the gym. Overall, a great buy, and much better than my old wired buds.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and battery life
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely great - the sound quality is very good ( I use a hifi streaming service and have been amazed at the sound through the earphones which can be adjusted to my preference using the equaliser through the app.)They are also really comfortable unlike a number of in ear phones, they don’t fall out but you can wear them for hours. Battery life is good and the charging case is solid but small enough to take anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Pip

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound, poor bass, too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as they were meant to be a match or even better than a set of Phillips buds I bought for less than half the price of these. A colleague has a set of Bose buds that these were meant to our perform too. I was very disappointed in the sound quality of these buds, the bass was poor and volume was not very loud, even using the equaliser I couldn’t get the bass high enough. Please don’t believe the hype of these and either wait for the new ones to come out or buy something cheaper that has much better quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Smitch916

customer_reviews.title: In The Ear, hardly noticeable .
customer_reviews.text: Just what I have been looking for after all theses years suffering with "chord's" restricting movement. I was going about the place without realising my phone was in another part of the building, excellent coverage. Keeping the volume down to a reasonable level there was no loss of clarity, and so small. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: merry-terry

customer_reviews.title: Signal constantly drops out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for exercise. But, they are not fit for purpose. The sound continuesly cuts out if your phone is in your pocket. I want to use them with a smart watch, but the music is constantly dropping out, which makes them unusable. Shame, as the sounds quality is good, but the fact that they cannot hold a solid connection renders them useless.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I use these in a gym that the noise is blasting in the gym and these cancel out the noise they are very loud and comfortable the sound quality is outstanding and I would highly recommend this product. I noticed there is a couple of feedback saying that they are not very loud but please remember on your mobile phone it has a limiter you have to go past the limiter using your phone then you'll find your ears will explode lol is plenty loud enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cripps

customer_reviews.title: they do what you expect
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound, good base. Overall very satisfied. Dropped one in water (2 sec subjerged) nothing happened. Riden with them on the rain and not a problem. Good fit in the ears and confort. Great to be able to pair 2 phones at the same time with calls coming in from any of them. The hear through option can be activated when you are listening to music with a double click to the right side. Music will pause and you can hear and aswer to people without taking them out.
customer_reviews.author: Engel

customer_reviews.title: Just brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all different blue tooth headphones for running and each one there has been one thing not totally satisfied with BUT these are amazing. They stay secure in ear never have to adjust. The sound quality is awesome. The use per charge is excellent then to add to that the case re charges them! I can not express how these are the best headphones I have used for running! Especially being a long distance runner these see me through those 4 hour run easy. To some these up... brilliant just brilliant
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: Just love them
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty nervous about buying these - much more expensive than I'd ever spent before on earphones for running. But they're just great: fantastic fit, great sound, very easy to use without any complex controls to go wrong, charge seems to last fine. They feel like someone designed these with a lot of care and love. I look forward to listening with them every time. One minor quibble. They have fallen out once or twice while running. A bit scary as they can easily scatter off, or perhaps break, but they seem to be fine so far. But other than that a very gratifying purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PROF M. COOPER

customer_reviews.title: THE best earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a fair few pairs of ear buds and always wanted a set of bluetooth ones so I did my research and came up with the 65t's. I was going on a work trip to london town and needed connectivity. They are amazing. On the trip I found out I could wear them as one or as a pair and they adjusted automatically. If I took my right one out to speak to the ticket collector the left one would mute (or go quieter depending on the distance). The case is a charger and it lasts a LONG time. I use my earbuds frequently and I don't charge my case that often. Very good. I reccommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Martyn Jones

customer_reviews.title: Bad design for ear buds
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is ok but in my opinion not loud enough. The worst thing is that the little plastic mould that goes around the nozzle for your ear bud broke off after two weeks of intermittent use. That means the ear buds come off and get stuck inside the ear canal because they can’t grip into the body of the speaker. I ordered two different sets of ear moulds to try and rectify but they dont contain the inner rubber seal which has rendered these headphones useless..
customer_reviews.author: Kashebo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit, good sound, suffers from interference and battery memory effect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and decent enough sound, although if you are in a noisy environment on call, your caller will struggle to hear you. I've played with all the settings in the rather limited app and it doesn't help. Unlike my previous wired wireless bluetooth headphones, these ones badly suffer from interference. Anything can trip them up: switching lights on and off, stray wi-fi signal... Finally, after some 9 months of use suddenly the battery life went sharply down; I now have to charge them twice as often as before.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Won't Connect.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could tell you how this product sounds, but it unfortunately wouldn't connect to my phone at all. I tried everything and followed a tonne of guides, but everytime it looked like it was about to connect it would say "no device connected" and drop out. Definitely going to return and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Cannot compete in current market!
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely bulky and you need bigger ears to these in places. If you compare them with current models in the market 2020, it doesn't make sense how these are so bulky. Literally fall out when I walk with them on. Yes the sound quality is good, but it doesn't justify how portable they are. I got them free with a fitbit so there must be a reason they are free. I had much higher hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these as I fancied some wireless earphones and couldn’t justify the Apple version. The service was quick and the buds were well packaged. Only been using them for a few days, so far I’m really impressed with them. They fit snuggly and are very comfortable. I’ve only had them in a for a few hours at a time, not sure how they would feel having them in for the whole day. Sound quality is pretty good too. I’m really impressed with them and would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R.

customer_reviews.title: Charging is frustrating and extremely hit and miss.
customer_reviews.text: Pro’s: Sound quality is good, navigation using buttons works well, fairly comfortable and don’t stick out. Secure enough for running and gym. Battery life is ok if they charge properly. Con’s: Charging is a major pain, half the time they have only charged half way or 75%. Their isn’t any indication on charging level or at the very least charging has initiated like on the Elite Sports. I’ve moved over to them and haven’t looked back. Overall disappointed, if they don’t charge correctly they kind of end up being useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. T. Instone

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: Elite 65T - nice headphones, sound quality very good. Excellent charging case. Battery lasts ages. I don’t find them partially comfortable in my ears and they do start to hurt after around 40 mins. However I am happy with my purchase, nice headphones. Occasionally they do cut out, but very quickly reconnect. Love the fact I can connect to multiple devices (5 I think).
customer_reviews.author: Jase

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality and controls, but sometimes falls from ear during sports! Fit is not very secure.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality, good controls, and good look/design for the product. However the fit was not very secure for me, even though I tried all the different ear foam tips, and put on the earplugs according to the instructions. The earplugs would stay on most of the time, but sometimes they would fall over if you bent over, had some impact on your body (such as jumping or even dropping a heavy weight) - which is mega annoying, especially considering these are market as sports headphones. On that basis alone I deducted 2 stars from score.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Dinis Ormonde Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: MAJOR FLAW
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good but there’s a MAJOR flaw Once you find a rubber ear bud You cannot charge it. When you insert into the case which also stops it working when you stop using it Trust you can force closure but more than likely it will bounce and fall apart outside when you use it It seems to drop off easily as well rather than poking the ear buds deep Sending it back thank god for amazon !
customer_reviews.author: 💪

customer_reviews.title: 4/5. Buy the low profile comply tips.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and lock into ears. probably as good as wireless headphones without ear hooks can be. Jaybird 1s/x4/freedoms have better isolation and base, but these are truly wireless with better battery and charging case. Tinny sound lets these down, but can be improved with the app. Buy the comply tips that are low profile to fit charging case. expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: michael gordon

customer_reviews.title: Try all the ear bud sizes!
customer_reviews.text: I was profoundly disappointed in these on first hearing them compared to my Bose sound sport wireless buds. These were thin and cheap sounding. The bass semmed absent entirely. They need to go back, I thought. I sat down and then wondered if the default silicone buds were the right size. It turned out the ones installed by default are the medium size. I installed the large ones instead and it was a night and day transformation. Much greater than I have experienced with other in ear buds. Would recommend so far.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harte

customer_reviews.title: Annoying white noise in left earbud
customer_reviews.text: After a few uses one of the earbuds started making a noise. Getting a replacement took ages (a couple of weeks). But the replacement was also making noises. Upd: The second replacement developed the same issue after a few days. Reducing rating even further...
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Was deciding whether to buy these or the beats pro i did use galaxy icon X before and they were rubbish kept disconnecting took the plunge got these and tried them on my gym workout absolutely brilliant stayed in my ears like glue sound was brilliant , running, weights and cycling these was a absolute joy to use and I found them very comfortable maybe my ears are just shaped perfect for them , the charge case was nice and compact and I've had no disconnecting problems once on a 2 hour training session on continue playback paired with a iPhone 8plus
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit and good sound
customer_reviews.text: Have used for a few months now and love them - great fit (I would previously not have been a fan of in-ear headphones but these were recommended by a friend). Find them very comfortable and stable on long walks. Now I am working from home use for conference calls etc, have a good mic pick up for conversation. Purchased from Warehouse so good price too.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lochrin

customer_reviews.title: Smart features not so smart.
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to work out what HearThroughTM is good for - customer service has not been of any use so far just saying that "it works when you are not on calls", and Alexia integration by the inbuilt microphone doesn't seem to work either. They are good sound quality but all these smart features Jabra claim to offer I cannot seem to get to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: SimyJo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for sport
customer_reviews.text: The quality of sound is good, but very disappointing overall as I bought these for the gym and they won’t even stay in for a jog. I can’t even do press-ups without them falling out. Very disappointing. I think I have ‘normal’ ears (I’ve never had this issue before), but I suppose it is possible that I am in the minority. There are plenty of positive reviews, after all.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Finally a set of earphones that live up to the hype. After trying several different options I can say I have found a pair that are worth the money. Firstly they fit perfectly in the ear with no movement when running. Sound quality is excellent and the app helps you to fine tune it to your own preference. All in all I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Simon warr

customer_reviews.title: Loud background noise for the person the other side
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient, good connection, not too complicated, simple and discrete but the sound quality is funny gives a head and ear ache after half an hour. if there is a train announcement or having crisps while speaking to my mother, she complaints like as if someone is banging on her head with a loud crisp or chewing noise. So in my opinion after almost a year use - Jabra didn't get this right and it's not cheap if it doesn't cancel background noise.
customer_reviews.author: UH

customer_reviews.title: Only in ear buds that fit
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and although these are not noise cancelling, because of the design and the fact they fit in the ear so well, they block the outside world out better than my noise cancelling headphones. I have never got a conventional pair of in ear headphones to stay in my ears, tried Apple, Samsung, Sony and Panasonic! These stay in no problem, even while cycling or running, massively recommend for any activity. Charging/Storage case is small and easy to work out regards the charging.
customer_reviews.author: S Beswick

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I love these Jabra earbuds. They are really well made, sound fantastic and are feature packed. They charging case is great and the batter life of the earbuds themselves is very decent. They can connect to 2 devices at once and connectivity is perfect. Also very comfortable to wear and they don't fall out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great bluetooth earphone, pair right away, activate when you take them out of the case, which is a nice feature and the sound is great also. Be warned however, these are for use with phones/tablets and not a laptop, so far I have been unable to pair with a laptop for teams/skype calls and based on others feedback I do not think it is possible.
customer_reviews.author: DarthJango

customer_reviews.title: Great but not for runners
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement to my Bose Soundsport which I’d previously owned for two years. Chose these due to IP5/6 rating and good reviews. At first I was really impressed. The sound quality is great. Small charging case is great. Hear through function is really good. I wasn’t happy when I ran with them though. Sounded like when you stick your finger in your ears and wiggle them around. I’d recommend these for everyday use, gym etc. Not recommended for runners though. Ordered some more Bose
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect to 3rd party bluetooth transmitters
customer_reviews.text: I love these - only 1 MAJOR floor, I cannot connect them to my portable bluetooth transmitter that use for the Gym. I usually plug the transmitter into the audio out on the runner this then pairs with my Bose headphones me sing so can watch the screen wirelessly. I cannot do this with these headphones as you need to be able to select them from the screen on your phone. They sound great but this is a real issue. I have emailed Jabra three days ago and met yet had a response yet/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at these for a while but didn’t want to spend £150 on a set of headphones I even bought a £40 pair of Chinese wireless earbuds But after a couple of months I took the plunge what can I say Wow the sound quality is night and day Brilliant well worth the extra £100 Other stuff Comfortable fit you will forget you have them in Noise-Cancellation- yes blocks out the outside world Can’t comment on the phone features as have no friends to talk to
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David R. OLIVER

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay in my ear
customer_reviews.text: Was torn between these and the Powerbeats Wireless Pro. Went for these as a friend had a set and recommended them, plus they were £50 off over Black Friday so a good deal. However, for me I could not satisfactorily get them to stay in my ears. I bought these for the purpose of wearing whilst exercising, but even just sitting around they felt insecure and would start to slip out. Even with the largest insert fitted they would not stay. Whilst the sound quality appeared good I spent more time faffing about trying to stop them falling out so have had to return them. Not for me unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Mr F

customer_reviews.title: Good product let down by charge case and tech support
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds work and work well. Had very few connection issues and i’m Getting 5 hours runtime from a full charge. However that battery in the charge case is too small meaning you need to charge it every day. Plus I suspect my charge case is faulty as I only get one full charge of the earbuds from the charge case. Still waiting on tech support to get back to me on that.
customer_reviews.author: R. Maines

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Seriously disappointed. Can’t seem to keep them in the ear. Tried all three sizes and simply making phone calls the buds fall off after 15min. On the tread mill can’t go beyond 1km before they fall. Also once the fall it seems like the he’ll warms up or something because I can’t keep them on anymore. They simply start falling out straight away until maybe an hour later where I can get longer time out of them. I tried using different tips from other buds and they worked perfectly but they can’t fit in the charging case. So in a nutshell spent lots of money and back to using my old cheap once.
customer_reviews.author: Ammar Ammar

customer_reviews.title: Not great!
customer_reviews.text: Fine for listening to music and watch videos, sound is adequate rather than loud. Probably the best you can hope for with something this size. For phone calls though, don't even bother. Callers frequently complained that all they can hear is background noise, even walking by light traffic apparently sounded unpleasantly loud their end, while my voice sounded distant. Having to resort to my trusty wired headphones with my phone's much needed 3.5mm headphone jack! I've always been a bit a skeptic about our supposed 'wireless future' and this has only confirmed my beliefs! Could be a hardware fault I suppose but to be honest they're probably more trouble than they're worth.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stent

customer_reviews.title: Good , but just for phones really.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on sale to use with my Astell and Kern Jnr music player but it's a real carry on to connect and the volume is fixed. they work fine with my Iphone and Ipad, fully functional. I mailed the Jabra support but they never replied, if I had paid full price they would have gone back! Sound quality is good, not as good as my Shure SE535s, but fine for the price. just a shame they don't work properly with my main music player.
customer_reviews.author: P. Embleton

customer_reviews.title: Substandard quality
customer_reviews.text: They’re 💩, got some 2 days ago. The hissing in the left earbud is distracting and not acceptable at a price of £169.99. When talking to people on the phone with the jabra’s they could hear all background noises, as if they were amplified. I brought the airpods yesterday and all of the above issues were not present, and they do sound a lot better then the wired versions contrary to what other reviewers say. Spend your money wisely and don’t go for substandard. I will be sending the jabra’s back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Thetechman

customer_reviews.title: Decent connectivity, but some challenges
customer_reviews.text: The bluetooth on this (with Pixel 2) is a strong and reliable connection. No lag with video or even when connected to TV box. But the ear tips can be annoying and challenging to fit. A (minor) fault has appeared where the buds no longer 'beep' when I change the volume -- customer services sent an email advising how to reset and reinstall firmware, but this did not solve the issue and now they are not following up with a warranty request. This is worth bearing in mind when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality & battery longevity
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with these headphones, used them for over a month daily and their performance excellent. I listen to a mixture of podcasts and music: Voices are clear and volume wise there's quite a nice "headroom" type of feeling about the playback. Music isn't as good however, it's still way above what I'd expect for completely wireless headphones. They're light but not overly light so as you can't feel them in your ears, used on a 2 hour train journey they remained comfortable throughout. You can operate them with a single ear if required.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: Great pair for the price (returned due to size)
customer_reviews.text: Had these some time back and I was initially amazed with the quality of sound and built. The app is great too to try various options. It did not have true noise cancelling compared to the bose ones I have but for the money spent it was doing great. The only downside was the size was a little big for partner who I ordered these for hence had to return ...
customer_reviews.author: NEERAJ KANT

customer_reviews.title: Good but can be much better!
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews I went for this instead of Cambridge ones and b&o which are similarly priced around the £100.00 mark. The Cambridge ones have a much better battery life compared to this one. I would have to say I am a bit disappointed with this ones. I was expecting a much better sound having had the Marshall ones although they are on the ear headphones.These earbuds are not meant for excellent sound but serve the purpose as a mix between office calls/ regular calls and then to listen to music and watch movies/videos.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

product_meta.title: Jabra Elite Active 65t Earbuds - Passive Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Sports Earphones with Motion Sensor for Fitness Tracking - True Wireless Calls and Music - Copper Blue
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Active| Colour Name:Copper BlueJabra Elite Active 65t earbuds
Optimise your workouts and track fitness and performance with the integrated motion sensor. 4-microphone technology is proven to deliver superior wireless call performance by creating a noise-blocking zone. The comfortable fitted in eargels in three different sizes are perfect for calls and music on-the-go. Want to customise your sound? No problem with the Jabra Sound+ app equalizer. With one touch you can connect with your virtual assistant to quickly get the information you need. And with the integrated voice command set appointments, find nearby events, or have messages read back to you. Get up to 5 hours of battery life from a single charge and 15 hours in total with the included pocket-friendly charging case.

Product features:
- Wireless range: up to 10 metres
- Charging time: Up to 2 hours
- Auto turn-on: When taking earbuds out of charging case
- Auto pause: Auto pause when one earbud is taken out of the ear
- 15 minutes rapid charge provides up to 1.5 hours of battery life
- Fitted silicone eargels
- Bluetooth 5.0 standard
- IP56 water and dust resistant

Jabra
Whoever you are, wherever you go, there’s a Jabra product that’s designed with you in mind. It’s what Jabra do.
THOUGHTFULLY DESIGNED. PURPOSEFULLY ENGINEERED. EXPERTLY BUILT.

BOX CONTAINS
Charging case, micro USB cable, 3 sets of silicon EarGels, Quick Start Guide, Warranty and Warning Leaflets, TA label
feature_bullets: Long battery life and true wireless stability: With up to 15 hours of battery time with the pocket-friendly charging case, the Elite Active 65t earphones let you take calls and play music while staying connected
Ear gels for a perfect fit: Choose the right size to ensure great sound quality and increase comfort in every circumstance
Built for active lifestyles: Sweat resistant and IP56 weather-resistant rating against dust and water

Dedicated voice command, sound and call control through touch: Instantly connect your choice of virtual assistant, have one-touch calls or use the HearThrough feature to filter in the sounds that surround you
Scope of delivery: Jabra Elite Active 65t earbuds, charging case, 3 sets of silicon eargels, USB charging cable - Colour: Copper blue

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
